refnamediv.refpurpose: get textual description of state of an SSL object during read operation

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: SSL_rstate_string() returns a 2 letter string indicating the current read state of the SSL object ssl.
SSL_rstate_string_long() returns a string indicating the current read state of the SSL object ssl.

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: When performing a read operation, the SSL/TLS engine must parse the record, consisting of header and body. When working in a blocking environment, SSL_rstate_string[_long]() should always return "RD"/"read done".
This function should only seldom be needed in applications.

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: SSL_rstate_string() and SSL_rstate_string_long() can return the following values:

listitem.para: The header of the record is being evaluated.
The body of the record is being evaluated.
The record has been completely processed.
The read state is unknown. This should never happen.
